org.netbeans.api.editor

Class StickyWindowSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.api.editor.StickyWindowSupport

  • public final class StickyWindowSupport
extends Object
    Support for Sticky Windows in the editor. JComponents can be added to a layer on top of the editor. Components will update their vertical position on editor changes.
    Since:
    2.9

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addWindow(JComponent window)
      Add a sticky window to the editor.
      Point convertPoint(Point aPoint)
      Convert a aPoint in root component coordinate system to the editor coordinate system.
      void removeWindow(JComponent window)
      Remove a sticky window from the editor.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • addWindow

        public void addWindow(JComponent window)
        Add a sticky window to the editor.
        Parameters:
        window - the JComponent to add to the editor

      • convertPoint

        @NonNull
public Point convertPoint(Point aPoint)
        Convert a aPoint in root component coordinate system to the editor coordinate system. aPoint is assumed to be in the root component coordinate system of the editor. If conversion is not possible, return aPoint without any conversion.
        Parameters:
        aPoint - the Point to convert
        Returns:
        aPoint converted to editor coordinate system

      • removeWindow

        public void removeWindow(JComponent window)
        Remove a sticky window from the editor.
        Parameters:
        window - the JComponent to remove
